qas.question: Columbia Pictures has been owned by Sony since what year?
Who is the CCO of Sony Music?
Who became sister labels to ABC Records?

plausible_answers.text: back under common ownership with its former parent Columbia Pictures

qas.question: ABC's Arista Records was brought what?
Sony has been a Columbia Pictures division since what year?
Epic founder Clive who was brought back into the fold?
Davis no longer serves as what at Sony Music?

context: The merger made <b2_0>Columbia and Epic<b2_0/> sister labels to RCA Records, which was once owned by RCA which also owned CBS rival NBC. It also started the process of bringing BMG's Arista Records <b3_0>back under common ownership with its former parent Columbia Pictures<b3_0/>, a Sony division since <a0_0><b4_0>1989<b4_0/><a0_0/>, and also brought Arista founder <a1_0>Clive <b5_0>Davis<b5_0/><a1_0/> back into the fold. Davis is still with Sony Music as <b6_0>Chief Creative Officer<b6_0/>.
